title.narrative: Empowering Urban Development Stakeholders For Engagement At Global Milestones.

description.narrative:
By 2050, about 70 per cent of the world's population is projected to live in urban areas. Rapid urban growth is mainly occurring in developing countries with their specific governments unable to provide needed amenities by the urban population. The informal settlements in most cities of the world provide habitat to 33 per cent of the urban population. If left unaddressed, these trends may become sources of social and political instability.
The purpose of this project is to advocate for a new global approach towards urban development especially in developing countries. The project road map identifies key activities that would facilitate the building of capacities of relevant stakeholders for their substantive negotiations towards defining the global urban agenda and participation at global milestones. Capacities of all relevant stake holders must be harnessed to advocate for adequate policy tools, legislation and frameworks for urban governance. Such a strategy would expedite the realization of establishing sustainable towns and cities that are greener, livable, convenient, harmonious and environment-friendly. In doing this, city and others local and national level leaders would have opportunities to address the current policy gap at national level. Countries would thus profit from the opportunities presented to them by the urban process.

mailing-address.narrative: UN-HABITAT P.O. Box 30030 GPO Nairobi 00100 Kenya
